intro: Habracanthus trichotus, commonly known as the hairy habitant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
